intro: Boehmeria nakaiana, commonly known as Japanese nettle, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other species of nettle. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fine, stinging hairs on the stems and leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Boehmeria nakaiana is valued for its fibrous stems, which have been used in traditional crafts and papermaking.
